These create a high PEG concentration in a small volume for the 3’ ligation.
Batches of dried PEG PCR tubes can be made as follows.
Add 3 μL of 50% PEG 8000 \(supplied with NEB RNA ligases) into each strip tube and dry in the speedvac using low heat \(37°C).
This may take 1-2 hours depending on the speedvac.
Once dry, the PEG will appear as a white, flaky pellet in the bottom of the tube.
Cap the tubes and store desiccated at room temperature.
Note that the 50% PEG solution is very viscous, so care must be taken when pipetting.
Diluting the 50% PEG to 25% and aliquoting larger volumes may improve pipetting accuracy.
Positive displacement pipettes may also be helpful.
The dried PEG in the strip tube will take up about 1 μL in the reaction after resuspension.
